title: Pixel text font on Devoid Of Yesterday website
content:
Hello,

Anyone know what the pixel font found in the content area of this site is?

[http://devoidofyesterday.com/thingsfallapart/index.html#information](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083441/http:/devoidofyesterday.com/thingsfallapart/index.html#information "http://devoidofyesterday.com/thingsfallapart/index.html#information")

Cheers!

 [‹ Looking for a digital version of "Caratteri Franklin" shadow display face](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083441/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41662 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Rebirth Museum Logo - Elston {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083441/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41648 "Go to next forum topic")
author: joesomebody

comments.content:
I couldn’t find any exact match. You might want to e-mail the designer ( [http://arsthanea.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083441/http:/arsthanea.com/ "http://arsthanea.com/")).

Take a look at [Pixella](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083441/http:/www.vllg.com/Thirstype/Pixella/mudTyper+Weights/). It might be a good substitute, though the a and g (most notably) differs.

That may be another showing of one of the famous [Miniml](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083441/http:/www.miniml.com/) types, by Craig Kroeger.

Dav(id)
